body:
With https://github.com/sormuras/junit5/commit/2a0d0ba9d909d6dbf902ffecd57382b9a7347e30 applied, the second and third invocation of `gradlew test` results in:
```
[...]
:junit-platform-gradle-plugin:test UP-TO-DATE
BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 1.103 secs
11:33:56: External task execution finished 'test'.
```

issue.title: Revise task inputs for Gradle plugin regarding incremental builds (#631)

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

Fixes #631 by removing `path` and `configuration` from compile-time dependency declaration.

With the change applied, Gradle can quickly pass a sequence like `gradlew clean test; gradlew test; gradlew test` from the second `test` on with:
```
[...]
:junit-platform-gradle-plugin:test UP-TO-DATE
BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 1.103 secs
11:33:56: External task execution finished 'test'.
```
---

I hereby agree to the terms of the JUnit Contributor License Agreement.

body: Moved fix to own PR for clarity.

Reopening since the changes in #637 had zero effect.

Executing `gradlew test` after `gradlew clean test` still results in all `junitPlatformTest` tasks being executed again.

rename.from: Task inputs for JUnitPlatformPlugin are broken
rename.to: Task inputs for junitPlatformTest are broken

body:
Sorry for the inconvenience caused -- but my local setup showed the skipped `junitPlatformTest`s.

The **real** underlying reason is the always recreated shadowed `junit-platform-console-x.y.z.jar`, which in turn is due the changing `Build-Time` value within the manifest attributes. If you set the value to a fixed _time_, like:

```
shadowJar {
	classifier = null
	configurations = [project.configurations.shadowed]
	exclude 'META-INF/**'
	relocate 'joptsimple', 'org.junit.platform.joptsimple'
	[...]
  	manifest {
 		attributes (
			'Build-Time': '123'
		)
	}
}
```

a subsequent call of `gradlew test` is finished in under 2 seconds:
```
gradlew test
:buildSrc:compileJava UP-TO-DATE
:buildSrc:compileGroovy UP-TO-DATE
:buildSrc:processResources UP-TO-DATE
:buildSrc:classes UP-TO-DATE
:buildSrc:jar UP-TO-DATE

:buildSrc:test UP-TO-DATE

[versioning] WARNING - the working copy has unstaged or uncommitted changes.
```

> Sorry for the inconvenience caused -- but my local setup showed the skipped `junitPlatformTest`s.

No worries.

> The **real** underlying reason is the always recreated shadowed `junit-platform-console-x.y.z.jar`, which in turn is due the changing `Build-Time` value within the manifest attributes. If you set the value to a fixed _time_, like:

Aha. That would make sense.

Sounds like some added logic for the `generateManifest` boolean flag in `build.gradle` is in order!

Care to take a look into that?

issue.title: Make Gradle incremental build work

milestone.title: 5.0 M4
milestone.description: Themes: test templates, repeated tests, and parameterized tests.

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.title: Create console standalone executable jar

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

Create `junit-console-standalone-x.y.z.jar` with all dependencies included/shadowed.

Motivated by https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/258#issuecomment-268794285

Supersedes PR #259 and PR #596 -- might close ZIP-distribution/plain-old JAR related issues: #146 and #258

## Created archives in "build/libs"

### junit-platform-console
- `junit-platform-console-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar` **135** KB
- `junit-platform-console-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-javadoc.jar` **59** KB
- `junit-platform-console-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-sources.jar` **33** KB

### junit-platform-console-standalone
- `junit-platform-console-standalone-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar` **846** KB

Standalone jar contains following generated `META-INF/MANIFEST.MF`, which declares the engine version numbers shadowed into it:
```
Manifest-Version: 1.0
Implementation-Title: junit-platform-console-standalone
Build-Date: 2017-01-23
Implementation-Version: 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT
Built-By: JUnit Team
Specification-Vendor: junit.org
Specification-Title: junit-platform-console-standalone
Implementation-Vendor: junit.org
Build-Revision: 4b91f4596cabebeccbc49c9dce31e7e1c853f21f
Build-Time: 10:26:59.577+0100
Created-By: 1.8.0_102 (Oracle Corporation 25.102-b14)
Specification-Version: 1.0.0

Main-Class: org.junit.platform.console.ConsoleLauncher
Engine-Version-junit-jupiter: 5.0.0-SNAPSHOT
Engine-Version-junit-vintage: 4.12.0-SNAPSHOT
```

## Open ends
- [x] The `checkStandaloneConsole` task only prints the current **wrong** version information (see snippet below) provided by the only jar left, the standalone one. The `META-INF/MANIFEST.MF` files from the engine jars are not longer available, so the mechanism used to retrieve the version and artifact information reports the string found in the current project manifest, namely `junit-platform-console`.
```
Jan 19, 2017 9:40:31 PM org.junit.platform.launcher.core.ServiceLoaderTestEngineRegistry loadTestEngines
INFORMATION: Discovered TestEngines with IDs: [
junit-jupiter (group ID: org.junit.jupiter, artifact ID: junit-platform-console, version: 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT), 
junit-vintage (group ID: org.junit.vintage, artifact ID: junit-platform-console, version: 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT)
]
```
Fix proposed in https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/pull/633/commits/a900e3090ea241d87cb56478a53afd1a884463c2
- [x] _call it `junit-console-x.y.z-standalone.jar` or `junit-platform-console-x.y.z-standalone.jar`?_ https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/258#issuecomment-273890999
Created new subproject `junit-console-standalone-x.y.z.jar` gathering all dependend artifacts.

- [x] Update user guide, section http://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/user-guide/#running-tests-console-launcher
- [x] Update M4 or M5 release notes
- [ ] Document new artifact with dependencies in https://github.com/junit-team/junit5#dependency-metadata ?

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the JUnit Contributor License Agreement.

body:
```
:platform-tests:junitPlatformTest UP-TO-DATE
:platform-tests:test SKIPPED

BUILD SUCCESSFUL

Total time: 1.974 secs
```

The latest fix works like a charm.

Thanks, @sormuras! ðŸ‘
